intro: Galium austriacum subsp. balatonense, commonly known as Balaton bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild sedative properties.
